intro: Benthamia catatiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved benthamia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Benthamia catatiana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments.
